name: Kepler-332
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-332 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-332 is a star with 0.615 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.72 times its radius. It is located 1133.88 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-332 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-332 b

Kepler-332 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.63 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-332.

The mass of Kepler-332 b is 1.39 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-332 b is 1.17 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-332 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-332 c

Kepler-332 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.00 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-332.

The mass of Kepler-332 c is 1.18 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-332 c is 1.09 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-332 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-332 d

Kepler-332 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 34.21 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-332.

The mass of Kepler-332 d is 1.42 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-332 d is 1.18 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-332 d is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-332, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
